name: cnrnvc

stmt.origin: mp2an(wcel(c0, cnvc), wcel(ccnfld, cnrg), wcel(ccnfld, cdr))
stmt.pretty: mp2an(c0 ∈ NrmVec, CCfld ∈ NrmRing, CCfld ∈ DivRing)

body.origin:
|- wcel(c0, cnvc)
-| wcel(ccnfld, cnrg)
-| wcel(ccnfld, cdr)
-| wi(wa(wcel(ccnfld, cnrg), wcel(ccnfld, cdr)), wcel(c0, cnvc))
body.pretty:
⊢ c0 ∈ NrmVec
⊣ CCfld ∈ NrmRing
⊣ CCfld ∈ DivRing
⊣ ((CCfld ∈ NrmRing ∧ CCfld ∈ DivRing)→ c0 ∈ NrmVec)

stmt.origin: syl5eqel(c0, cnvc, cfv(crglmod, ccnfld), wa(wcel(ccnfld, cnrg), wcel(ccnfld, cdr)))
stmt.pretty: syl5eqel(c0, cnvc, (ringLMod ` CCfld), (CCfld ∈ NrmRing ∧ CCfld ∈ DivRing))

body.origin:
|- wi(wa(wcel(ccnfld, cnrg), wcel(ccnfld, cdr)), wcel(c0, cnvc))
-| wceq(c0, cfv(crglmod, ccnfld))
-| wi(wa(wcel(ccnfld, cnrg), wcel(ccnfld, cdr)), wcel(cfv(crglmod, ccnfld), cnvc))
body.pretty:
⊢ ((CCfld ∈ NrmRing ∧ CCfld ∈ DivRing)→ c0 ∈ NrmVec)
⊣ c0 =(ringLMod ` CCfld)
⊣ ((CCfld ∈ NrmRing ∧ CCfld ∈ DivRing)→(ringLMod ` CCfld)∈ NrmVec)

cumulated.origin:
|- wcel(c0, cnvc)
-| wceq(c0, cfv(crglmod, ccnfld))
-| wi(wa(wcel(ccnfld, cnrg), wcel(ccnfld, cdr)), wcel(cfv(crglmod, ccnfld), cnvc))
cumulated.pretty:

body.origin: |- wi(wa(wcel(ccnfld, cnrg), wcel(ccnfld, cdr)), wcel(cfv(crglmod, ccnfld), cnvc))

comment: The module of complex numbers (as a module over itself) is a normed vector space over itself. The vector operation is ` + ` , and the scalar product is ` x. ` , and the norm function is ` abs ` . (Contributed by AV, 9-Oct-2021.)
